topics.body:
Guys, I have good news and bad news.

The good news is that I might go to Germany for college.
The bad news is that I _might_ go to Germany for college.

Right now, it's uncertain whether or not I was chosen for the scholarship but I received a call recently from the office that asked me whether or not I am confirmed on going and then said that they would call back. That call was a few hours ago and I am extremely nervous.

I guess they're checking those who still want the scholarship since most of the participants are already in local colleges or other scholarship programs. The scholarship I took was a bit negligent as it didn't process the candidate choices early enough so everyone (including myself) was forced to make a risky decision. 

I should be in a local college right now but instead, I took the risk of waiting for my scholarship. So, I really hope on getting this program.

[bq]And the UK theme is Pop vs Rock.[/bq]

Fun fact: There's more to Europe than a single country.

topics.body:
"@Dashu":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557d8a606368727584004310#post_557d8a606368727584004310
I want to travel.
I don't want to go to the local college.
Not because it's terrible, which it isn't.

Just because I want to go somewhere else.

My sis studies in England while my bro is a pilot. I don't want to be the only one who didn't do anything amazing in his young life. It's not about pride. It's about... well, I don't know really. I don't want someone who maybe looks up to my bro and sis and when meeting me, feels down because I'm not as great. 

I know I'm not as great as them. I just don't want someone to look at me like that.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
